intro: Striga thunbergii, commonly known as the yellow striga, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Striga thunbergii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
